data.title: Gasper Metzger Butcher (abt.1758-1815)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Gasper Butcher born abt. 1758 Augusta, Virginia died 1815 Murphysboro, Jackson, Illinois, United States including ancestors + descendants + 2 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 8 May 2024 | Created 1 Sep 2013

This page has been accessed 887 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Sources

3 Research Notes

4 Acknowledgments

Biography

Soldier Gasper Butcher served with Clark's Illinois Regiment, Virginia State Troops during the American Revolution.

Gasper, son of George Valentin & Maria Elizabeth Kiefer Metzger. The translation of Metzger from German to English is butcher, so when George and his family emigrated to Virginia around 1755, they started to use Butcher as their surname.

Husband of Catherine ( Yoakum ) Butcher.

SAR Lists spouse: Catharine XX; and children: Samuel; Mary Polly; John; Jacob; George W; [1]

Gasper was a trapper & Indian fighter. He also was a member of the Gen. Geo. Rogers Clarke expedition. [2]

He participated in the capture of Fort Kaskaskia and the town of Cahokia from the British, thus securing the whole of the Illinois Territory for the American Republic.

Gasper was born about 1758.

9 children

He passed away in 1815.

Sources

↑ SAR https://sarpatriots.sar.org/patriot/display/126425

↑ "Compiled service records of soldiers who served in the American Army during the Revolutionary War, 1775-1783", National Archives microfilm publications; M0881, database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:3Q9M-C3M8-6LJB?i=359&cat=484382: viewed 3 March 2024), Bus-Cartel (NARA Series M860, Roll 8), Film # 8445750 Entry for Gasper Butcher, images 360-361 of 6424.

"Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QKJS-CCB6 : 17 May 2018), Gasper Butcher in entry for William Grubb and Mary Butcher, 15 Jan 1814; citing Marriage, Warren, Kentucky, United States, various county clerks and county courts, Kentucky; FHL microfilm 164,003.

"Descendants of George Valentin Butcher" https://hackerscreek.com/norman/BUTCHER/GEORGE%20VALENTINE.htm

"Find A Grave Index," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QVV8-K3H4 : 27 July 2019), Gasper Butcher, ; Burial, Murphysboro, Jackson, Illinois, United States of America, Holliday Farm Cemetery; citing record ID 15519550, Find a Grave, http://www.findagrave.com.

Research Notes

He may have been born or lived in Deer Run, Brunswick, Virginia

https://www.familysearch.org/tree/person/vitals/KGM8-5GH
